CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 8, 1955, pg. 13 reads: " 'Aloha!' Au Revoir! Good-Bye! - All three were wished upon Miss La Doris McClaney of 616 Wilkinsburg Avenue and some of the city's top basketball stars at a party given in their honor by the parents of Miss McClaney in their home recently. Left to right, front row, seated are: Morris Hill, Alberta Thompson, Arnold Sowell, Barbara Robinson, Reubin Kurby.  Second row, left to right: Mary Bean, Eleanor Bean, Arlene Prundty, "Pat" Doe, Miss McClaney, Mary Cummings, Vurnetta Bradley, "Pat" Prattis.  Standing: Vera Thompson, Edward Fleming, Maurice Stokes, Charles Hefflin, Standley [sic] Bethel Friday, Curtis Ross, Horace Hord, Bill (Sy) Green, Seth Sneed and Robert Fredrick.  "Bill" Powell of radio station WILY made recordings of the event. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait from left, front row: Morris Hill, Alberta Thompson, Arnold "Arnie" Sowell, Barbara Robinson, and Reubin Kurby; second row: Mary Bean, Eleanor Bean, Arlene Prundty, "Pat" Doe, La Doris McClaney, Mary Cummings, Vurnetta Bradley, and Patricia "Pat" Prattis (Jennings); standing: Vera Thompson (Matthews), Edward Fleming, Maurice Stokes, Charles Hefflin, Stanley Bethel Friday, Curtis Ross, Horace Hord, Bill "Sy" Green, Seth Sneed, and Robert Fredrick, posed in McClaney home for party at 616 Wilkinsburg Avenue
